basics.name: Dale Price
basics.label: Web Developer
basics.summary: I'm a web developer specializing in front-end development with interests in UI and UX design and web animation design and techniques. I enjoy participating in Ludum Dare game development competitions and experimenting with 3D printing.

work.summary: Front-end design and development on multiple web application products used by oil&gas companies for optimizing drilling processes.
highlights: Created interactive data visualizations using D3, Crossfilter, and other front-end technologies, collaborating with an agile team to develop approaches for processing, aggregating, and presenting large amounts of data in near-real-time.
Worked with users to ensure that our interface and workflows supported their goals when using the product, giving our products a user experience advantage over established competitors.
Worked with stakeholders to design and develop marketing materials.

work.summary: Developed and produced low-cost 3D printed prosthetic hands in collaboration with Shriners Hospital for Children and the E-Nable project
highlights: Conducted user testing and gathered feedback from patients using our devices in order to iteratively tweak and refine the devices.

work.summary: Joined the International Space Station Program Integration & Control team developing websites for other NASA departments and exploring options for a potential change of CMS.

highlights: Built and maintained websites for clients including local businesses in Houston and organizations at Baylor University using custom WordPress themes and plugins
Developed a PHP-based web application to enable players of an online game to present data about themselves from the game's REST API.
